alert.note: Alert for Far South Miami-Dade County; Mainland Monroe (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 11 at 3:23PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Mainland Monroe and southern Miami-Dade Counties through 400 PM EDT... At 322 PM EDT, National Weather Service meteorologists were tracking a strong thunderstorm near Flamingo, moving southwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and frequent lightning strikes. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Flamingo. LIGHTNING...EXCESSIVE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: These winds can down small tree limbs and branches, and blow around unsecured small objects. Seek shelter in a safe building until the storm passes. Excessive cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Far South Miami-Dade County; Mainland Monroe
